wiki.text:
A 'cocycle' refers to any one of the following:

*A closed cochain in algebraic topology is called a cocycle.<ref> page
173</ref> *A particular type of map in an autonomous dynamical system; see
Oseledec theorem.

Let G be a graph with vertex set V. A cut is a partition S = {X, X'} of V into
two nonempty subsets. We denote the set of all edges incident with one vertex in
X and one vertex in X' by E(S) or E(X, X'); and any such edge set is called a
'cocycle'.

There is also a meaning in group cohomology.
wiki.title: cocycle
